column4: hi guys i change my promt PS1 but now dont see in which folder i am
how can i put it again the default name, or at least see again the folder where i am every time
my PS1=${debian_chroot:+($debian_chroot)}\u@\h:\w\$
si pongo eso, ahora me sale "u@h:w$
sorry i mean that if i put that you post me here i recieve this in console u@h:w$
then run:    export PS1=${debian_chroot:+($debian_chroot)}\u@\h:\w\$
sorry man, nothing
then at the bottom of ~/.bashrc    add:  export PS1="\e[0;36m[\u@\h \W]\$ \e[m "             then save the new file and run:  source ~/.bashrc
now, come back again
all better?
any idea how?
if my PS1 is ubuntu@ip-10-48-201-56:/home$ and i want change only the ip after @ but remain the /folder_where_i_am any idea how can i do it?
I'm not that hot with PS1 dude, sorry
the guys in #bash may be able to help
surely aski
what?
do you have ssh keys setup?
yes, i can connect by ssh, the most funny thing is that the response is the command option of mysql like if i dont execute correctly the command
have you asked in #ssh too (or a channel for ssh)
dont know that exist thanks!
its worth a try
